items.title: Lawrence Summers Has Come Back From Scandals. Will This Be His Last?
items.summary: The former Harvard president has come back from controversy before, but revelations in new Epstein emails are threatening his omnipresence in public life.

items.title: Cheney Service to Underscore How Politics Has Changed Since He Was in Office
items.summary: As the former vice president is honored at Washington National Cathedral on Thursday, many eyes will focus on who comes — and who does not.

items.title: Tennessee House Race Rivets Democrats and Worries Republicans
items.summary: Still the favorites, Republicans have grown nervous about a House special election that could show whether the political environment continues to shift leftward.

items.title: Arrest Is Made in 1991 Texas Murder After Students Step In
items.summary: Criminology students from the University of Texas at Arlington re-examined the case of Cynthia Gonzalez, whose body was found south of Fort Worth. Their work led to an arrest this month.

items.title: Miss Hall’s Students Accused a Teacher of Sexual Abuse, But Prosecutors Won’t Charge Him
items.summary: Despite evidence of sexual abuse by a Massachusetts teacher, prosecutors said no criminal conduct occurred. Now survivors are trying to change consent laws they say “offered cover” to their abuser.

items.title: Howard Lutnick’s Family Business Is Cashing In on Data Center Deals
items.summary: The commerce secretary, Howard Lutnick, is involved in A.I. data center deals that overlap with work his family is doing. Our investigative reporter Eric Lipton describes what we know about these deals for massive data center projects, one of which includes a planned nuclear power plant to be named after President Trump.

items.title: Justice department has 30 days to release all Epstein files after Trump signs bill – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Trump attacks Democrats as he seeks to shape the narrative surrounding his links with the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein</p><p>The <strong><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-administration">Trump administration</a></strong> presented a new plan to roll back regulations in the <strong>Endangered Species Act (ESA)</strong> on Wednesday, a move experts fear will accelerate the extinction crisis if adopted.</p><p><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">The proposed</a><strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6"> </a></strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">changes</a> would allow the federal government more power to weigh economic impact against habitat designations, remove safeguards against future events – including the impacts from the climate crisis – and rescind the “blanket rule” that automatically grants threatened species the same protections as those designated as endangered.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/nov/20/donald-trump-jeffrey-epstein-justice-department-zohran-mamdani-news-updates-us-politics-live">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump officials reveal plan to roll back regulations in Endangered Species Act
items.summary: <p>Experts fear plan, one of many attempts Trump’s made to dismantle wildlife protection, will speed up extinction crisis</p><p>The Trump administration presented a new plan to roll back regulations in the Endangered Species Act (ESA) on Wednesday, a move experts fear will accelerate the extinction crisis if adopted.</p><p><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">The proposed</a><strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6"> </a></strong><a href="https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOI/bulletins/3fc00d6">changes</a> would allow the federal government more power to weigh economic impact against habitat designations, remove safeguards against future events – including the impacts from the climate crisis – and rescind the “blanket rule” that automatically grants threatened species the same protections as those designated as endangered.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/20/trump-endangered-species-act">Continue reading...</a>
